title: Prerequisite vs Assumed Knowledge
description: An interactive visualization showing the three layers of knowledge foundations (Assumed Knowledge, Prerequisite Knowledge, New Content) as stacked building blocks, demonstrating how learning builds on prior knowledge.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Education
Instructional Design
Learning Theory
Curriculum Design
learningObjectives: Define assumed knowledge, prerequisite knowledge, and new content
Explain the difference between assumed and prerequisite knowledge
Identify potential issues when assumed knowledge gaps exist
Design appropriate prerequisite assessments for a course
prerequisites: Basic understanding of instructional design concepts

controls.description: Hover over knowledge layers to see descriptions, examples, and characteristics

limitations: Does not show individual concept dependencies within layers
